channel.title: Best way to practice/learn Java?
channel.description:
Hello, I am a beginner at Java. I recently started to take a class on Java, and I want to use what knowledge I now know while learning some news things. There are a couple of things I want to do, but mainly I want to write my own server base/edit a base. So my question is:
- Do you all know of any blank bases and clients (like just has walking and the map)? or do you have a link that I will teach me how to write my own source from COMPLETE scratch?
I really want to do either of these. I want to learn a lot, and eventually start running a server. If you have any suggestions or can answer my question please leave a comment.
Thanks!

item.title: Best way to practice/learn Java?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Its simple, you don’t. Just experiment and figure out why stuff does what it does, and the rest is just applying the same thing to different things.

Read full topic

item.title: Best way to practice/learn Java?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Who needs the learn java! I don’t have a clue as to what I’m doing when I code RSPS I just put a ; after everything!
http://www.javacoffeebreak.com/java101/java101.html

Read full topic

Buy a book, seriously. They tend to help alot.

I have a book.
[/quote]

Owning a book isn’t good enough. You’re going to have to read it.[/quote]

lol I have a book, and I read the book. I take a class on it so thats when I read it.

item.title: Best way to practice/learn Java?
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

xryz:

I haven’t created my own server yet, though i plan on it sometime. look into hyperion or apollo. they aren’t entirely blank but they are close to being blank. ik there are some sources out there that are what you are asking about but thats been years ago since ive messed with rsps. I’m not an expert so take my advice with a grain of salt but you need to study on how a server works. the protocols and stuff. here is supposed to have some info that would be useful: http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/ . also if you do dl the apollo or hyperion base just go through the source code, thats what it sounds like you want to do anyways. idk where your skill and knowledge of program is at but it isn’t a beginners task to make a server. you have to a good understanding of networking, cryptography, and other concepts. knowing basics of programming and not much of other concepts isnt going to get you far, you need to need to understand advanced concepts, and techniques. not trying to be a downer just trying to forewarn, you so you are prepared to the journey ahead. I wish you the best of luck.

Thanks man. This helped a lot. I will look into those sources again, and tell you if I can get them running.

Read full topic

item.title: Best way to practice/learn Java?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

I haven’t created my own server yet, though i plan on it sometime. look into hyperion or apollo. they aren’t entirely blank but they are close to being blank. ik there are some sources out there that are what you are asking about but thats been years ago since ive messed with rsps. I’m not an expert so take my advice with a grain of salt but you need to study on how a server works. the protocols and stuff. here is supposed to have some info that would be useful: http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/ . also if you do dl the apollo or hyperion base just go through the source code, thats what it sounds like you want to do anyways. idk where your skill and knowledge of program is at but it isn’t a beginners task to make a server. you have to a good understanding of networking, cryptography, and other concepts. knowing basics of programming and not much of other concepts isnt going to get you far, you need to need to understand advanced concepts, and techniques. not trying to be a downer just trying to forewarn, you so you are prepared to the journey ahead. I wish you the best of luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Best way to practice/learn Java?
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:10, topic:430730”][quote author=b b0yz 4 link=topic=533407.msg3900355#msg3900355 date=1327707486]

I have a book that teaches me Java. I just want to start using RSPS to learn to. do you all not read the question?

THIS IS NOT A SPOONFEED COMMUNITY. IF YOU WISH TO ASK A QUESTION, DO SO BY SHOWING YOU HAVE DONE TO HELP YOURSELF, AND POSSIBLE WHAT YOU THINK MAY WORK. IF YOU DIS-OBEY THIS, YOUR THREAD CAN AND WILL BE LOCKED.

You read the comments from earlier, troll?
[/quote]
You do realize he’s the one you’ve been talking to this whole time right?

OT: Java Docs, can’t just hop into building a server an expect to have a stable foundation on knowing Java, I would recommend learning a easier language first so you get use to some key operations (maybe Virtual Basic, linked to very in depth guide on it).[/quote]

I already know BASIC. I know all of the general coding language. I am not looking for tutorials for Java. I want to practice my Java using RSPS. I am looking for a blank client or source that I can use to practice my programming on while developing the source to a server that I would like to use in the future. I appreciate your alls help, but that is exactly what I am looking for and I have been searching for at least a week unsuccessfully.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:9, topic:430730”][quote author=Classic_ link=topic=533407.msg3900333#msg3900333 date=1327706091]

I have a book that teaches me Java. I just want to start using RSPS to learn to. do you all not read the question?

THIS IS NOT A SPOONFEED COMMUNITY. IF YOU WISH TO ASK A QUESTION, DO SO BY SHOWING YOU HAVE DONE TO HELP YOURSELF, AND POSSIBLE WHAT YOU THINK MAY WORK. IF YOU DIS-OBEY THIS, YOUR THREAD CAN AND WILL BE LOCKED.
[/quote]

You read the comments from earlier, troll?[/quote]
You do realize he’s the one you’ve been talking to this whole time right?

OT: Java Docs, can’t just hop into building a server an expect to have a stable foundation on knowing Java, I would recommend learning a easier language first so you get use to some key operations (maybe Virtual Basic, linked to very in depth guide on it).

Read full topic

item.title: Best way to practice/learn Java?
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

ziplock:

The best way to learn is to ask questions, and try to understand the language, not just memorize it. Try to write a program and examine the Javadocs. There’s not a miracle method to learn extremely fast, you just have to slowly learn like any other skill.

Thanks. That is what I am doing now to learn it, but I want to start mixing that practice with RSPS. That way I can kill two birds with one stone. Practice Java while making a source for my server.

Read full topic

item.title: Best way to practice/learn Java?

item.description:

The best way to learn is to ask questions, and try to understand the language, not just memorize it. Try to write a program and examine the Javadocs. There’s not a miracle method to learn extremely fast, you just have to slowly learn like any other skill.
